title: Scott's Tots
description: Ten years ago, Michael promised a group of third graders he would pay for their college tuition if they graduated. Now comes time to pay, and he can't do it. At the office, Dwight's employee of the month idea gets Jim in big trouble.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You wanted to see me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, Have a seat.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Is it serious? [Michael stares]  Wow.  Andy's a wittle scared.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, right there is the problem.  There have been reports around the office that you have been talking baby talk.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Why would people say that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I have it on good authority that you said the following. [hands Andy a notecard]  Can you read that back to me?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Andy have a boo-boo tummy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mmm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Would you rather me say "Hey guys, my irritable bowel syndrome is flaring up?"

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: "Crazy diarrhea happening right now?"  Cause things can get real adult real fast.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You are also on record as saying "wittle-ittle," "footy-wutties," "nummies," "jammies," "make boom-boom," "widiculous," and "wode iwand."

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Do I sometimes replace Rs with Ws? Yes.  Do I sometimes repeat a word to get my point across?  Well if I do, Andy's sowwy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You can't be a baby in the office.  It makes me look like I hire babies.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well if I we're complaining, a lot of people think your Elvis voice is annoying.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, who said that?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I don't-just people.  For the record, I think it's pretty fantastic.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Elvis voice] Well, thank you... thank you a lot.  And for what it's worth I think your baby voice is tops.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [baby voice] Tank you Mr. Elwis.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [as Elvis] You're welcome, baby.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Dr. Tuna, MD, I have some terrible news.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wait, are you the patient or the doctor?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: The entire office has come down with a pernicious case of the Mondays.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow, what do you put our chances at?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: 0%, unless we perform an immediate emergency morale transplant, stat!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hmm, sounds risky.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Don't worry.  There is a surefire cure.  Employee of the Month.  Every awesome place I've worked has had one.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Bear Stearns, Lehman Brothers, AIG, my summer at Enron.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow, that's not such a bad idea.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Great! [sits down]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Anything else?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Nope! [stands up and leaves]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Frankie's Dirty Joke of the Day?  There's a bunch of those.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Keep.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: There's a bunch of Sent e-mails that jusy say "Delivered."  Should I delete all of those?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I want to keep those so I can see what I sent.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: That's why you have a "Sent Mail" folder.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Keep.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: There's about 30 news alerts for "Nip Slip."

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: For what?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: "Nip slip."

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh okay.  I don't know how those got on there...

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Well...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Must be hackers.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey.  What's up?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What if I told you I had done the worst thing ever, would you still want to be my friend?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Did you murder someone?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Worse than that.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh, my God.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Lurk much?  [Erin leaves] I miss Pam.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I think she's okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Is that what we're going for now?  "okay?"  We used to go for "pretty good."

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Great.  Hey, how do you feel about starting an Employee of the Month program?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, you know what, that actually might make me feel better.  I'm not in this for the trophies, but...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You're not in it at all, because you can't be employee of the month, you're a manager.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, technically, I'm a co-manager, and I barely have any responsibilities, but I work hard, I love this company, and for those reasons, I think I would make a good employee of the month.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It would look bad.  Sorry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It would look good, on my mantle.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Jim's talking to Michael right now.  They totally went for our idea!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah!  Your idea.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: My idea.  I just need Andy to think it's his idea.  So it won't get traced back to me.  In approximately six hours, Jim will get a phone call from David Wallace.  He will be fired.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Hey Pam, do you have a sec to check over this inventory?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [glances at it] Looks great.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh, did you really look it over?  Felt like maybe you didn't.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay. [picks up and reads sheet]  The Michael Scott Foundation is still in existence?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There you are.  I don't think we have finished with my Inbox.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: What's "Scott's Tots?"

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Has it really been ten years?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: [shows newspaper article and reads] "Local businessman pledges college tuition to third graders"

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael, why did you promise that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: To change lives.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No Michael, why would you promise that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, okay.  Call the school, cancel.  I can't go through with this.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: We've already rescheduled seven times.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael, this is a terrible terrible thing you've done.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It's terrible.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Just terrible.  And the longer you put it off, the worse it's going to get.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I just, I fell in love with those kids.  and I didn't want to see them fall victim to the system, so I made them a promise.  I told them that if they graduated from high school, I would pay for their college education.  I've made some empty promises in my life, but hands down, that was the most generous.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just tell me it is going to be okay, all right?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm not a bad person, I bring good news.  Like when I promised those kids I'd pay for college.  Okay, all right.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You have to tell them.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Would you come with me?  You know, like old times, instead of... [makes yuck face at Erin]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I can print out a new itinerary with Pam's name on it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It's fine.  Erin, you're going to go.  And you're going to make sure Michael tells the truth.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Agh, God, you know what, could this day get any worse?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey Jimmy, what's up?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Not much.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Cool.  Very cool.  I bet if you tried, you could grow the best beard of anyone in this office.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [laughs] Thanks Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That laugh is so infectious.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You're creeping me out.  I'm gonna go.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I didn't mean any of those things I just said.  And you can expect the same from everyone in this office if you don't nip this whole Employee of the Month situation in the bud.  Make it about the work.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Let me guess, you think you should get it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: This encompasses all available data.  Hours, tardiness, unconfirmed sick days, participation.  Everyone has been assigned a random number for total fairness and transparency.  Also, this should be accompanied by a monetary prize.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, in an ideal world...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: In an ideal world, I would have all ten fingers on my left hand, so my right hand could just be a fist for punching.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, if it's all the same to you, I'm just going to take away "Survival Skills" and "Self-defense."

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm going to run this by Toby and Accounting and have him assemble the data.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's okay, I'll do it.

quotes.speaker: Mikela
quotes.text: Mr. Scott?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, Mikela Lasker, how are you?

quotes.speaker: Mikela
quotes.text: I'm good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good to see you.  Where's your saxaphone?

quotes.speaker: Mikela
quotes.text: It's in the music room, Mr. Scott.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Eigth grade graduation, she gave a rendition of When The Saints Go Marching In that would blow your freaking mind.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Wow!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, you didn't even hear it.

quotes.speaker: Mikela
quotes.text: Everyone's so excited that you're here today.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, good.

quotes.speaker: Mikela
quotes.text: Now, I know you probably want to see everyone, but I was wondering if I could ask you some questions first?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [points to a sign saying The Michael Gary Scott Reading Room] You're famous.

quotes.speaker: Mikela
quotes.text: I'm sure you remember this place.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Mikela
quotes.text: Do you want to go in?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, not at all.  Nope, come on.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, you know what?  You know what?  I shouldn't go in there.  I'm pretty busy, I should just...

quotes.speaker: Mikela
quotes.text: We just want to say thanks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Students
quotes.text: [cheering] Mr. Scott!  Mr. Scott!  Mr. Scott!

quotes.speaker: Teacher
quotes.text: Mr. Scott, I know you're a busy man, and your schedule moves around a lot.  But through all your generosity through the years, your tots, who are ready to graduate, thought it was time to give you a proper thank you.

quotes.speaker: Students
quotes.text: [getting up and dancing] Oh!  What?  Oh! Break it down!  Hey, Mr. Scott!  What you gonna do?  What you gonna do, make our dreams come true!  Hey, Mr. Scott!  What you gonna do?  What you gonna do, make our dreams come true!  Hey, Mr. Scott!  What you gonna do?  What you gonna do, make our dreams come true!

quotes.speaker: Lefevre
quotes.text: You came into our lives and made a promise, made us honest, made us realize, we don't need to compromise, cause we can have it all!  Cause you made it possible, for us to achieve the improbable!

quotes.speaker: Students
quotes.text: Hey, Mr. Scott!  What you gonna do?  What you gonna do, make our dreams come true!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wow!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey, so Jim thought it would be ideal if we all pitched in-

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So Jim thought it would be ideal if we all pitched in a 20 for this whole Employee of the Month thing.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Jim said that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: He thought you were doing an incredible job last month.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Jim said that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You seem suprised.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: No, no, that makes total sense.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey buddy, so every-

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Sure. [puts in the twenty]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Five minutes ahead of schedule.  Right on schedule.

quotes.speaker: Teacher
quotes.text: Politicians are always coming around, telling us they're going to fix our schools, promising this and that.  But you, Mr. Scott, you are actually doing it.  You have taught these kids with hard work, that anything is possible.  You are a dream maker and I thank you!  I thank you, I thank you, I thank you, I thank you!  So much.

quotes.speaker: Lefevre
quotes.text: There were a lot of times over the years where I was pressured to get into the drug game.  But I always thought back to my guardian angel, and the gift that you gave me.  So I just want to thank you for giving me the opportunity to go to college, educate myself, and become the next President Obama.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [crying] Oh, God.  Oh, God.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, ladies and gentlemen, Welcome.  I know you're all very excited, but no matter who gets this, I just want to say that you are all employees of the monthin my eyes.  And the winner is, employee number nine.  And that is?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Number nine, number nine.  Jim Halpert.

quotes.speaker: Everyone
quotes.text: Huh?  What?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Are you kidding me?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, no!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, wait, I was not... I did not-

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I... I... I did not... That was not... How come not?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Guys, listen.  This was anonymous, all right?  There is no way I could've given it to myself because I didn't even know who was on here.  I just gave it to the employee with the highest overall score.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: To my tally, you just won back your own parking spot, a vacation day, and a nice, tidy quarter of $1,000 from all of us.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Will everybody stop for a second, because obviously I'm not taking any of it.  A mistake has been made and we'll figure it out.  Second of all, there was no cash prize.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, you said "In an ideal world, there would be a cash prize."  Isn't that what you said?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, Dwight, I meant... Yes, in a perfect world, someone would get money.  But-

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Yeah, but in your perfect world, only you get money.

quotes.speaker: Teacher
quotes.text: Let's put your hands together and give a warm welcome for the man of the hour, Mr. Michael Scott.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right.  Wow.  Um, I am never going to forget today.  Not a chance.  I don't think I could ever give back to you what you have given me today.  Who here has done something stupid in their lives?  Like skipped out on study hall or mix up the difference between "A" gym and "B" gym, that sort of thing?  Show of hands, anybody, yes, a bunch of you, okay.  Well, me too, I've done something stupid which I would like to share.  Ummm. [period bell rings] Should we go?

quotes.speaker: Teacher
quotes.text: Oh, no.  We're okay.  It's a double period

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah.  All right.  I came here today because I promised you tuition and tuition is very valuable.  But you know what's invaluable is intuition.  You know what that is?  That is the ability to know when something is about to happen.  Does anybody out there have intuition?  Know what's gonna happen next?  Nobody?  Okay, you're going to make me say it.  All right, I am so proud of all of you.  Derrick, and Lefevre, and Ben, and Ayana, and Mikela, and Nikki and Jason, and... I'm sorry, okay, sorry spacing, your name?

quotes.speaker: Zion
quotes.text: I'm Zion, I'm Mikela's younger brother.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well Zion, I am not going to be paying for your college tuition.  Which brings me to my main point and that is that I will not be able to pay for anybody's tuition.  I'm so, so sorry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm sorry.  I'm sorry.  I'm so sorry.

quotes.speaker: Mikela
quotes.text: You lied to us.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I lied to myself too.  I'm not a millionaire.  I thought I would be by the time I was 30, but I wasn't even close.  And then I thought maybe by the time I was 40, but by 40, I had less money than when I was 30.  Maybe by my 50s, I don't know.  I wanted to pay for your education.  I really did.  It was my dream.  Some people have evil drems, some people have selfish dreams or wet dreams.  My dream was in the right place.

quotes.speaker: Lefevre
quotes.text: You owe this to us!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, hold on.  Hold on.  Now I can't pay for your college.  But you don't have to go to class to be in class.  Online courses are a viable option to a traditional college experience.  And the best way to access those courses is with your own personal laptop. [students perk up] Which is rendered useless without batteries, and I have one for each of you.

quotes.speaker: Students
quotes.text: [yelling]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, hold-hold on, hold on, hold on, hold on.  They're lithium.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Look, there was a big mistake obviously, so I will fix it.  Okay?  This was your idea anyway.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Correction.  It was my idea.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: My idea!

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Guys, I'm starting to think Pam's not really even pregnant.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ok, for the record, I am pregnant and, obviously there has been some kind of a mistake, so why doesn't Jim just pick the next highest score on the list and we'll move on.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: That's fair.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Excellent idea, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That would be employee number three, which would be... son of a bitch, Pam Halpert.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: How is that possible?  No offense Pam, but how the hell is that possible?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: There must be some reasonable explanation for this.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, wait, come on.  I didn't miss a day, I came in early, I stayed late, and I doubled my sales last month.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, really? From what, two to four?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yup.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Guys, this isn't some elaborate scam, okay?

quotes.speaker: Delivery Man
quotes.text: Hi, I have an order here for a custom cake, Jim Halpert.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.  That is me, but I didn't order the cake.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Look who it is! [shows camera the cake, which has a picture of Jim]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: "It could only be you!"  Way to go.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: He knew all along!

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I'm going to have some cake.

quotes.speaker: Stephanie
quotes.text: David Wallace's office.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [imitating Kevin] This is Kevin Malone, is David there?

quotes.speaker: Stephanie
quotes.text: No, he's in his weekly staff meeting, can I take a message?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Tell him I'm mad at Jim, because he's asking us to give money to Pam.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [imitating Stanley] This is Stanley Hudson.  Jim Halpert is a menace.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [imitating Toby] It's Toby Flenderson.  Listen, things are getting really bad down here.

quotes.speaker: Lefevre
quotes.text: Hey, Mr. Scott.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Erin, can you give us a second?

quotes.speaker: Lefevre
quotes.text: That was messed up what you did.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah. Yeah. I know, I know, I know, I'm sorry.

quotes.speaker: Lefevre
quotes.text: Who does something like that?  Who promises that to a bunch of kids and then just doesn't come through like that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What can I do?

quotes.speaker: Lefevre
quotes.text: You can pay for my college.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I can give you an extra laptop battery.  Not everyone took one.  How about this?  If you can find a way to pay for your college tuition, let me buy your books, okay?

quotes.speaker: Lefevre
quotes.text: They're expensive.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, well, I owe you that at least, right?

quotes.speaker: Lefevre
quotes.text: It's about $1,000.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really? Wow.  That's over $200 a year.

quotes.speaker: Lefevre
quotes.text: No, $1,000 each year.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: For-okay, okay here's what I'm gonna do.  I'm going to write 4 checks for $1,000 each.  I'm going to date them one year apart.  Now, you are to use one check a year.  And please call me before you cash the check?  Cause I've got monies to move around.

quotes.speaker: Lefevre
quotes.text: Okay. Okay.  Make it out to my mom, Rosa.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's a lot of zeroes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: This is Jim.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Jim, what the hell is happening there?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, uh David.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So there was a little bit of a miscommunication here today.  It's been a little wild, uh, but I am on it.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Just so I understand, you started Employee of the Month, give it to yourself, then people complain, so you give it to your wife?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Am I missing something?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I really don't know how it happened, David.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I know how it happened.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Dwight is listening to the recording-pen from Jim's office]

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Jim, I bumped you up because I thought you could make my life easier.  If you can't do that, we're going to have a separate discussion.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: All right, it will not happen again.  I promise.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Uh, hey, I'm sorry.  I'm taking this out on you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No!

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: It's been crazy here.  You know I think you're doing a great job, right?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah.  Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Okay.  Hey, we still on for dinner this weekend?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, you're kidding me!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: See you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Damn it!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Hey Mr. Scott, What you gonna do, What you gonna do make our dreams come true.  Hey Mr. Scott, What you gonna do--

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Please stop.  15 lives.  I destroyed 15 young lives today.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: No, there's financial aid, uh, they could join the army or the navy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You're what, like, 12?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: The principal told me that 90% of Scott's Tots are on track to graduate, and that's 35% higher than the rest of the school.  So I think if you hadn't made that promise, a lot of them would've dropped out.  Which is something to think about, I think.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I think you're doing a great job.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What do you want from this job, provided the company doesn't go out of business?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I've always wondered what it might be like to be an accountant.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yes, but I'm terrible at math so...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know, when I hired Kevin, he was actually applying for a job in the warehouse.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Seriously?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.  I just sort've had a feeling about him.  I have a feeling about you too.

quotes.speaker: {michael} and {erin}
quotes.text: Hey Mr. Scott, What you gonna do, What you gonna do make our dreams come true.  Hey Mr. Scott, What you gonna do, What you gonna do make our dreams come true.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: See you tomorrow, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Apparently.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: How's it going?  Good day?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Not now, Temp.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Um, okay, so, um, listen.  I know about your diabolical plan.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What?  Diabolical plan?  I wouldn't even know how to begin a diabol... [Ryan holds up a written copy of Dwight's daibolical plan]

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I found a copy of it in the copier tray.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So what do you want?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I want the same thing you want.  I want to take Jim Halpert down.  I want in.
